The parentheses may include parameter names separated by commas:
(parameter1, parameter2, ...)

Defining-and-calling-a-function_key7: Once a function is defined it can be called (invoked) from anywhere in the document, by typing its name followed by a set of parentheses, like sayHello() in the example above this is how we call a function.
Defining-and-calling-a-function_key9: The above `code` is the example of function. The js function `key`word helps us to define a function. The parameter name is like a `variable` which will take the argument we passed to the function as a value. Return is a `key`word which stores the value of a function and gives the value whenever we call the function like console.log(sayHello("Pragna")).
